title: Merge pull request #44 from fdw/settingsMigration
message:
Merge pull request #44 from fdw/settingsMigration

Migrate from old settings

title: Adhere to vibration setting
message:
Adhere to vibration setting

The new notification did not care whether the user wanted it to vibrate. This is now fixed.

title: Migrate old settings to new ones
message:
Migrate old settings to new ones

The name of the shared preferences was changed so that both MainActivity and TimerService could load them. Now, we introduce a migration mechanism to port the old values to the new ones.

This commit also sets a settings version so that we can recognize old settings and can migrate accordingly.

title: Merge pull request #43 from fdw/notifications
message:
Merge pull request #43 from fdw/notifications

Notifications

title: Fixed flickering when starting a timer
message:
Fixed flickering when starting a timer

So it seems I added one update of the timer too much. Looks much cleaner now :)

title: Add possibility to stop timer
message:
Add possibility to stop timer

For some reason, I forgot to implement the possibility to stop a timer in the TImerService. Of course, this has some weird effects like the background service not stopping when the session is stopped.

This commit changes that.

title: Don't force app to foreground when countdown finished
message:
Don't force app to foreground when countdown finished

On the one hand, this fixes the disappearing notification; on the other hand it improves the UX: After a session is finished, the user should be notified. The standard way for this on Android are Notiifications, so we should use those. Additionally forcing the app in the foreground is unnecessary and possibly annying.

title: Send TimerService to background after session is over
message:
Send TimerService to background after session is over

To prevent the forground Notification, the TimerService is sent to the background when the countdown is finished. This should be okay, since it does not need to run when no session is running.

title: Improve presentation
message:
Improve presentation

There was a short delay when a session is started where the activity
would show the last remaining time instead of the current one. This was
caused by the TimerService only sending intents when the remaining time
decreased, but not when the timer was started.

title: Remove completion notification when MainActivity is opened
message: Remove completion notification when MainActivity is opened

title: Manage session type in the TimerService
message:
Manage session type in the TimerService

First, TimerState is split into TimerState and SessionType, as these are independent facets.

Then, the TimerService becomes more active and decides the session duration by itself based on the current SessionType. This work should rather be done here, in the class that also manages the timer, instead of the GUI, where only stuff concerning the viewing should be done. This is also important if we ever implement a widget.

title: Move Wakelock to TimerService
message:
Move Wakelock to TimerService

Because the TimerService is doing the work, the Wakelock should rather
be there instead of the GUI thread.

title: Some cleanup
message:
Some cleanup

* Rename method
* Reorder methods under their caller

title: Extract Notification building into its own class
message:
Extract Notification building into its own class

Building the notifications takes up quite some space, so we can extract it into a helper class with static methods. The TimerService's responsibility is tracking the remaining time and starting and finishing a session, not specifically building a Notification.

title: Make Notification disappear after click
message:
Make Notification disappear after click

Thi "finished" notification should not stay in the drawer forever, but disappear after use.

title: Reorder methods
message:
Reorder methods

This only improves readability.

title: Handle countdown completed in TimerService
message:
Handle countdown completed in TimerService

We should not rely on the Activity for notification and settings
restoriation. Instead, this should be handled in the TimerService, and
the MainActivity can offer additional notifications.

Ideally, only immediate GUI stuff should remain in MainActivity, and
everything else should be handled elsewehere.

Related issues:
 #36, #22

title: Use preferences in both MainActivity and TimerService
message:
Use preferences in both MainActivity and TimerService

Sometimes, the MainActivity checks the preferences and then instructs
the TimerService to do something (i.e. disable WiFi and audio). Since
this is a rather roundabout way to do things, the preferences have no
gained a name and can thus be checked from both classes. In a future
commit, the TimerService can decide for itself whether to disable sound
or not.

Unfortunately, this removes the old preferences. We need either a way to
migrate the old ones, or accept that the user must set the new ones
again.

title: Notify via Notifications
message:
Notify via Notifications

Instead of using homebrew sound and vibrations notifications, let's send a real Notification to the user about the ended session. This also means that we can access the LED :)

Related issues:
#16, #25, #36

title: Merge pull request #28 from wolfgang42/prefs-cleanup
message:
Merge pull request #28 from wolfgang42/prefs-cleanup

Preferences cleanup

title: Merge pull request #29 from fdw/refactor
message:
Merge pull request #29 from fdw/refactor

Refactoring/Cleanup

title: Merge pull request #30 from fdw/travis
message:
Merge pull request #30 from fdw/travis

Add travis configuration

title: Add travis configuration
message:
Add travis configuration

I hope this works, because I have no idea, what I'm doing ;)

title: Move preference getters to separate class.
message:
Move preference getters to separate class.

See discussion in #28 for details.

title: Add versioning preferences
message:
Add versioning preferences

Instead of checking whether a preference was set, add a version to the preferences and check if it is still current. This makes it possible to migrate the settings instead of mercilessly deleting them.

title: Simplify resetting of preferences
message:
Simplify resetting of preferences

The old method was quite convoluted and always threw a ClassCastException. The new one should work equally, but much more cleanly.

title: Fix style issues
message:
Fix style issues

* Remove one unnecessary comment
* Rename method to better reflect its purpose

title: Break up initialization
message:
Break up initialization

Again, many more small functions with one clearly defined responsibility. Now you can actually understand what happens just by reading the code once.

title: Remove unnecessary comment
message:
Remove unnecessary comment

This comment added nothing, so it's now gone.

title: Extract more common functions
message:
Extract more common functions

So much code was written twice instead of extracted into a smaller, low-level method. This refactoring makes the higher level methods more readable and shorter, while increasing code reuse.

But all the small functions should probably find a home in another class or two...

title: Split into smaller functions
message:
Split into smaller functions

Many methods do many things with no abstraction. To improve readability (and enable a better modularization), small chunks have been extracted into their own methods. Unsurprisingly, this supports code reuse.

title: Remove erroneous call
message:
Remove erroneous call

The exact same call happens some lines earlier, but depends on the setting KEEP_SCREEN_ON. So why call it again unconditionally?

title: Fix bug regarding old Wifi state
message:
Fix bug regarding old Wifi state

The previous wifi state was not saved and could thus not be restored.

title: Add logging for the main functions
message:
Add logging for the main functions

This is actually quite helpful when debugging mysterious happenings. We
should've done this sooner.

title: Fix bug with new onPreferenceChanged
message:
Fix bug with new onPreferenceChanged

The explicit conversion to String is needed, as Android otherwise tries
to find a String resource with the given ID - that is the number of
completed sessions.

title: Simplify formatting of timer label even more
message:
Simplify formatting of timer label even more

String.format is not very performant, so let's avoid it we don't need it.

title: Don't allow instantiation of PreferenceKeys
message:
Don't allow instantiation of PreferenceKeys

This is just a collection of String constants, so please don't instantiate it!

title: Make onPreferenceChanged faster
message:
Make onPreferenceChanged faster

The method already knows which parameter changes, so let's use this information. We don't need to change things that haven't changed.

title: Get all preferences from SharedPreferences
message:
Get all preferences from SharedPreferences

This makes those global variables unnecessary and thus removes redundancy. Instead, we always get the values from SharedPreferences.

There should probably be a better way to define the default values, though.

This is related to issue #22

title: Don't save preferences additionally in the Bundle
message:
Don't save preferences additionally in the Bundle

The preferences are stored separately, why should we save them again?

title: Skip creation of Toast
message:
Skip creation of Toast

Why create it if it is never shown?

title: Simplify switch statement
message:
Simplify switch statement

This simple conditional should do the same work while being more
readable.

title: Rename constant
message:
Rename constant

This way, we don't need the comment :)

title: Add visibility modifiers
message:
Add visibility modifiers

Let's make everything private that doesn't need to be seen

title: Separate formatting of timer label
message:
Separate formatting of timer label

Since this is called so often, it should be its own method.

Also, I have added many braces to clarify where if/else ends. These were just bugs waiting to happen...

title: Extract preferences names into a separate class
message:
Extract preferences names into a separate class

This will help to avoid typos when reading a preference.

title: Extract TimerState and UpdateTask
message:
Extract TimerState and UpdateTask

More nested classes moved into their own file. Again, this should make things more readable and better testable.

title: Make LicensesActivity more readable
message:
Make LicensesActivity more readable

Extracting the ContributorsFragment made both classes less crowded and more readable. This will probably also help with unit testing.

Additionally, common code was extracted into a separate method to save space and complexity.

Merge pull request #20 from wolfgang42/dismissable-notifications

title: Allow non-in-progress notifications to be dismissed.
message: Allow non-in-progress notifications to be dismissed.

title: Simplify display logic of the countdown
message:
Simplify display logic of the countdown

This is much easier to read (and probably to run) than to manually add
a "0" to the start of a one digit number. Let's make Java do the work.

title: Remove .idea folder from git
message:
Remove .idea folder from git

Since everybody probably has different settings for the IDE (I
definitely had), it makes no sense to track them in git. By ignoring the
whole folder, you can still have your own without accidentally commiting
them.
